title: Football in Papua New Guinea
text:
The <a href="sport">sport</a> of <a href="association%20football">football</a> in the country of <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a> is run by the <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20Football%20Association">Papua New Guinea Football Association</a>. The association has been affiliated with <a href="FIFA">FIFA</a> and the <a href="Oceania%20Football%20Confederation">Oceania Football Confederation</a> since 1966. The association administers national football and <a href="futsal">futsal</a> teams, as well as the <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20National%20Soccer%20League">national league</a>. Football is the most popular sport together with <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> in Papua New Guinea.
In 2016 PNG hosted the <a href="2016%20FIFA%20U-20%20Women%27s%20World%20Cup">U-20 Women's World Cup</a>.
League system.
Top clubs from PNG participate in the <a href="Oceania%20Champions%20League">Oceania Champions League</a> including in <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20OFC%20Champions%20League">2009-10</a> when <a href="PRK%20Hekari%20United">Hekari United</a> won that competition and went on to represent Oceania at the <a href="2010%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">2010 FIFA Club World Cup</a>.
